transportAdvice: Colombo has an extensive public bus network and a suburban rail line connecting key districts, though both can be crowded during peak hours. Tuk-tuks and taxis are widely available for shorter trips, and central areas like Fort and Pettah are walkable, though heat and traffic make long walks less practical.

weather.description: Warm and mostly sunny with low rainfall, making it one of the more pleasant months to visit.
Dry and hot with clear skies, ideal conditions for sightseeing around the city.
Temperatures begin to climb and it remains largely dry, though afternoons can feel very hot.
The first inter-monsoon period brings increasing humidity and occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
The southwest monsoon arrives, bringing heavy and frequent rainfall throughout the month.
Monsoon conditions continue with persistent rain and overcast skies; flooding can occur in low-lying areas.
Continued monsoon rainfall keeps conditions wet and humid, with rain often falling in prolonged spells.
Still within the monsoon season, expect regular heavy showers and high humidity throughout the day.
Rainfall begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month as the monsoon starts to withdraw.
The second inter-monsoon period brings renewed heavy showers and thunderstorms, often in the afternoons.
The northeast monsoon brings significant rainfall to Colombo, with wet and overcast conditions prevailing.
Rainfall gradually decreases through the month, with conditions improving toward the year's end.
